fields.summary: Snapshoting of a >10MB volume triggers errors

comments.body: [~vasya], others haven't seen this. Are you sure S3 was up and running?

I just tried this with Ceph for both object and block store and had no issue.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25680.87.20170105gitd579567.el7

Steps:
# created a volume
# created snapshot of volume

{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-create-volume -z one -s 1
VOLUME	vol-e5322528	1		one	creating	2017-01-13T18:08:19.496Z

[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-e5322528	1		one	available	2017-01-13T18:08:19.496Z	standard

[root@c-36 ~]# euca-create-snapshot vol-e5322528
SNAPSHOT	snap-33b292ae	vol-e5322528	pending	2017-01-13T18:08:45.304Z	000638591081	1

[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-snapshot
euca-describe-snapshot-attribute  euca-describe-snapshots

[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots snap-33b292ae
SNAPSHOT	snap-33b292ae	vol-e5322528	pending	2017-01-13T18:08:45.304Z	25%	000638591081	1

[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-33b292ae	vol-e5322528	completed	2017-01-13T18:08:45.304Z	100%	000638591081	1
{code}
This is in the SC logs. There are no errors propagation to an end-user.
[~vasya] I will try to reproduce again and check the logs.

I've been doing snaps of empty volumes a lot in the past 3 weeks, on (DAS|Overlay|Ceph) + (VPN|Edge) + (Deltas|No Deltas), often concurrent snapshots of the same volume, for EUCA-13114, and I have never seen this error. I don't know why. FWIW.

I have reproduced this issue. The problem occurs in the multipart upload path "Uploading snapshot snap-94e4b275 to objectstorage using multipart upload" so occurs when there is a large enough amount of data to upload to s3. I have not yet looked into the cause or impact of the issue.
My tests have always used 10GB volumes, FWIW.

The cause of the issue is a bad interaction of the AWS SDK for Java and ceph: {code} Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "POST /6b9dfe8f-35a1-4997-b1e0-79d377615aa0/548b6096-fb74-4a13-b9ca-30ddc5f7549f?uploads HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Host: localhost:7480[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Authorization: AWS CDJ2MPK86ABEGSI3XABE:YdrFPWR6vqIK02JTSqtweWb84Y8=[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.7.1 Linux/3.10.0-514.2.2.el7.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/25.111-b15/1.8.0_111[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 06:42:52 GMT[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Transfer-Encoding: chunked[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "Connection: Keep-Alive[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "0[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 >> "[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "HTTP/1.1 200 OK[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "x-amz-request-id: tx00000000000000000126f-005881b16c-343859-default[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "Content-Type: application/xml[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "Content-Length: 303[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 06:42:52 GMT[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "Connection: Keep-Alive[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:52 2017 << "6b9dfe8f-35a1-4997-b1e0-79d377615aa0548b6096-fb74-4a13-b9ca-30ddc5f7549f2~_XbyPS1aRxd-MIdOeu9RCmzuJZjh8pP" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "PUT /6b9dfe8f-35a1-4997-b1e0-79d377615aa0/548b6096-fb74-4a13-b9ca-30ddc5f7549f?uploadId=2%7E_XbyPS1aRxd-MIdOeu9RCmzuJZjh8pP&partNumber=1 HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Host: localhost:7480[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Authorization: AWS CDJ2MPK86ABEGSI3XABE:SgMVmNKwiZWFUfg0r+Tck2Jp/tE=[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.7.1 Linux/3.10.0-514.2.2.el7.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/25.111-b15/1.8.0_111[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 06:42:53 GMT[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Content-Length: 8388608[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Connection: Keep-Alive[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "Expect: 100-continue[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 >> "[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "Content-Length: 42[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 06:42:52 GMT[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "Connection: close[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "Error 400: Bad Request[\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "Bad request: [0[\r][\n]" Thu Jan 19 22:42:53 2017 << "[\r]]" {code} The InitiateMultipartUpload request is sent with a chunked transfer encoding even though there is no body. It looks like ceph handles the request correctly but leaves the body unread, this causes the next request on the HTTP connection to fail with a bad request error. This error is propagated to the object storage client as a 500 error which will probably mean the client will retry the action. For snapshot uploads this is not too much of an issue as the part upload will be retried and will succeed on a new HTTP connection. The issue can be reproduced using the AWS CLI: {code} # # cat ~/.aws/config [default] region = eucalyptus s3 = signature_version = s3 # # # ls -lh random10.dat -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 9.6M Jan 20 09:36 random10.dat # # # aws --endpoint $S3_URL s3 cp random10.dat s3://test/ upload: ./random10.dat to s3://test/random10.dat # {code} A ~10MB file or larger is used to trigger multipart upload. The request succeeds but running with debug errors are seen: {code} # aws --endpoint $S3_URL s3 cp random10.dat s3://test/ --debug 2>&1 | grep 'Error\|retry' 2017-01-20 09:56:03,861 - MainThread - botocore.client - DEBUG - Registering retry handlers for service: s3 2017-01-20 09:56:03,870 - MainThread - botocore.client - DEBUG - Registering retry handlers for service: s3 2017-01-20 09:56:03,897 - MainThread - botocore.client - DEBUG - Registering retry handlers for service: s3 2017-01-20 09:56:04,038 - Thread-3 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.CreateMultipartUpload: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,039 - Thread-3 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - No retry needed. 2017-01-20 09:56:04,039 - Thread-3 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.CreateMultipartUpload: calling handler > InternalErrorWe encountered an internal error. Please try again.test/random10.dat?uploadId=2~aB0YR-bbZ46mCjOt_4xdhWaJadZlTs8&partNumber=2de583a30-9b3c-464c-af56-390c6219433c 2017-01-20 09:56:04,123 - Thread-5 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,123 - Thread-5 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - retry needed: retryable HTTP status code received: 500 2017-01-20 09:56:04,123 - Thread-5 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - Retry needed, action of: 0.199914798426 2017-01-20 09:56:04,123 - Thread-5 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler > 2017-01-20 09:56:04,123 - Thread-5 - botocore.endpoint - DEBUG - Response received to retry, sleeping for 0.199914798426 seconds 2017-01-20 09:56:04,280 - Thread-4 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,280 - Thread-4 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - No retry needed. 2017-01-20 09:56:04,280 - Thread-4 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler > 2017-01-20 09:56:04,454 - Thread-5 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,454 - Thread-5 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - No retry needed. 2017-01-20 09:56:04,454 - Thread-5 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.UploadPart: calling handler > 2017-01-20 09:56:04,582 - Thread-6 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.CompleteMultipartUpload: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,582 - Thread-6 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.CompleteMultipartUpload: calling handler 2017-01-20 09:56:04,582 - Thread-6 - botocore.retryhandler - DEBUG - No retry needed. 2017-01-20 09:56:04,583 - Thread-6 - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event needs-retry.s3.CompleteMultipartUpload: calling handler > {code} a fix is to set the content-length on the InitiateMultipartUpload request to avoid the use of chunked transfer encoding.

The AWS SDK for Java multipart issue was fixed in more recent versions, so the fix for this issue is not needed in master:

https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java/pull/215
